Description: Register a new device in SCCM using credentials for a machine account
Extract cookie information from the user's browser by injecting into the browser process
Dump domain hashes for all domain users on the domain controller by copying the NTDS.dit file from an existing shadow

Test Case: Dump LSASS memory using Task Manager
Description: Use Task Manager to dump LSASS process memory to disk

Test Case: Extract SAM and System Registry folders
Description: Extract credentials from the Registry by exporting the appropriate folders to disk
Retrieve Kerberos TGS tickets from Active Directory for a few users (2-3) with service principal names (SPNs) set
Execute a malicious DLL's function directly using rundll32

Test Case: Sideload a DLL into a legitimate application
Description: Rename an attacker-controlled DLL to the name of a DLL expected by a legitimate application, move that DLL to be adjacent to the application, then execute the application in order to trigger the loading of the DLL by the legitimate application.
Using msiexec and an MSI payload, execute an exe embedded in the package
Disable the Windows Firewall using netsh.exe
Clear the Windows Event Log entries using the builtin wevtutil.exe to remove any attack indicators in the logs.
Add Windows Defender folder exclusion

Load a legitimate and signed kernel driver that is vulnerable to exploitation. Refer to projects like KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU/) for potential vulnerable drivers to use. Vulnerable, signed drivers provide a privileged (kernel) execution mechanism to attackers, allowing them to bypass security controls they couldn't otherwise bypass, such as by killing protected processes.
Create a firewall rule to block outbound traffic originating from EDR tool processes, preventing agents from sending data to their control plane
Download a malicious tool from a public hosting location onto the victim system
Establish a connection to a system using a legitimate remote assistance application. Where possible, use remote assistance software already in use in the environment.
Establish a bidirectional command-and-control connection from a managed asset to an external server on the Internet over HTTPS
Establish a bidirectional command-and-control connection from a managed asset to an external server on the Internet over HTTP
Establish an outbound connection to a server on the internet over FTP
Move to another system by using Windows Remote Management (WinRM) to spawn a process on that target system
Move to another system by using Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to spawn a process on that target system
Perform an interactive logon to a Windows system via RDP
Copy a payload to a remote target
Move to another system by creating a service remotely via Sysinternals PsExec
Coerce an authentication attempt by issuing an RPC request to a remote machine in order to capture/relay those credentials
Dump a Kerberos ticket from one system then use it on another system to make a network request to a domain resource (e.g. access a share)
Search for useful files on a domain share
Execute a series of discovery commands in sequence to gather information about the system/user/environment
Discover domain users and groups from Active Directory in bulk
Run an internal port scan to probe interesting ports and services.

Test Case: Extract data to cloud storage service
Description: Extract data from the internal network to a cloud storage service like MEGA, Google Drive, or Box
Create an Active Directory machine account

Test Case: Register a new device in Entra ID
Description: Register a new device in Entra ID
Persist access to a system by creating a new local user

Test Case: Add user to local Administrator group
Description: Add an existing local user to the local Administrators group

Test Case: Add user to Domain Admins group
Description: Add an existing domain user to the Domain Admins group

Test Case: Create certificate for principal via AD Certificate Services
Description: Create a certificate for the user or machine account by using Active Directory Certificate Services. This certificate can then be used to authenticate as the principal for things like Kerberos.
Run a payload during user login and startup by setting a Registry Run key
Persist on a system by creating a new scheduled task
In Entra ID, add a new credential to an OAuth application registration

Test Case: Configure a custom federated domain in Entra ID
Description: Convert a custom domain in the Entra ID tenant into a federated domain. This can be used for persistent access into the tenant.
Establish persistence on an account by registering a new MFA device

Test Case: Encrypt a large amount of files
Description: Encrypt a large amount of files on the endpoint to simulate ransomware
Delete volume shadow copies on the host to inhibit file system recovery
Send a phishing email to a target containing a known bad link

Test Case: Email QR code to known bad
Description: Send a phishing email to a target containing a known bad link formatted as a QR code
Send phishing email to victim containing a zipped LNK file attachment. This is intended to test the mail gateway (and sandbox analysis) in isolation.
Send a spearphishing attachment containing a malicious macro payload to a target
Log in to an external employee portal from an unexpected geolocation and with an unexpected user-agent to simulate a suspicious login attempt.
Have a user authenticate to the tenant using a device code flow
Perform a login brute force against an external SSO portal using a list of users/emails and a single password. Then, log into the portal using a valid credential.
Send a phishing message to a target user via a Team tenant not connected to the target user's tenant

Test Case: Spoof email by sending directly to tenant SMTP endpoint
Description: Send an email to a target that spoofs the sender's address to look like an internal user by using the target tenant's Exchange Online SMTP endpoint
Download a large amount of files from SharePoint within a short time period
Perform searches within SharePoint for documents containing credentials information
